text: The Asian Handball Nations Championship is the official competition for senior national handball teams of Asia (since 2018, also includes teams from Oceania), and takes place every two years. In addition to crowning the Asian champions, the tournament also serves as a qualifying tournament for the World Championship. ==Summary== Year Host Final Final Final Third place match Third place match Third place match Year Host Champion Score Runner-up Third place Score Fourth place 1977 Details Kuwait City 24–14 38–16 1979 Details Nanjing No playoffs No playoffs 1983 Details Seoul 25–19 31–21 1987 Details Amman No playoffs No playoffs 1989 Details Beijing No playoffs No playoffs 1991 Details Hiroshima 27–23 29–17 1993 Details Manama 26–22 1995 Details Kuwait City No playoffs No playoffs 2000 Details Kumamoto No playoffs No playoffs 2002 Details Isfahan 29–25 38–33 2004 Details Doha 28–24 27–26 2006 Details Bangkok 33–30 21–20 2008 Details Isfahan 27–21 24–23 2010 Details Beirut 32–25 33–30 OT 2012 Details Jeddah 23–22 25–21 2014 Details Manama 27–26 29–23 2016 Details Manama 27–22 25–16 2018 Details Suwon 33–31 29–21 2020 Details Kuwait City 33–21 27–26 ==Medal table== ==Related pages== *Asian Women's Handball Championship *Asian Men's Junior Handball Championship *Asian Men's Youth Handball Championship ==Other websites== *Asian Handball Federation *Archives at Todor66.com champ Handball
